clinical_study.brief_title: Perioperative Copeptin: Predictive Value and Risk Stratification in Patients Undergoing Major Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Perioperative Copeptin: Predictive Value and Risk Stratification in Patients Undergoing Major Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Observational cohort study examining the perioperative course of copeptin in patients undergoing elevated-risk surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: perioperative from induction of anesthesia to the third postoperative day
primary_outcome.description: copeptin concentrations for the perioperative time course as measured by the ThermoFisher assay at induction, at 0h, 2h, 4h, 6h, 8h, as well as on the postoperative day 1 and 3.

primary_outcome.measure: composite events composed of all-cause mortality and/or major adverse cardiac and cerebrovascular events (MACCE)
primary_outcome.description: MACCE defined as:non-fatal cardiac arrest, acute coronary syndrome (including MINS), congestive heart failure requiring hospitalization or transfer to a higher unit of care, and stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: composite events composed of all-cause mortality and/or major adverse cardiac and cerebrovascular events (MACCE)
secondary_outcome.description: MACCE: non-fatal cardiac arrest, acute coronary syndrome (including MINS), congestive heart failure requiring hospitalization or transfer to a higher unit of care, and stroke

study_pop.textblock: Male and female patients >18 years undergoing major vascular surgery will be invited to participate. Specifically, patients undergoing abdominal aortic aneurysm repair, suprainguinal and infrainguinal vascular surgery, as well as carotid surgery will be included. After the first 30 patients, the population is to be expanded to elevated-risk surgeries in general.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults >18 years
- Type of surgery for patients 1 to 30: abdominal aortic aneurysm repair, suprainguinal and infrainguinal vascular surgery, carotid surgery
- Type of surgery for patients 31 to 500: surgeries with elevated risks in general (as specified by 2014 ESC/ESA Guidelines on non-cardiac surgery:
cardiovascular assessment and management [Kristensen])
Exclusion Criteria:
- acute coronary Syndrome (ACS) at presentation (clinical assessment or documentation)
- Congestive heart failure at presentation (clinical assessment or documentation)
- Documented severe aortic stenosis (valve area <1cm2)
- Kidney dysfunction (clearance <50ml/min)
- Reduced left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) (<40%); if no LVEF is available, it will be assumed to be >40%
- Cancelled surgery
- Unwilling or unable to provide consent
- Inability to follow the procedures of the study, e.g. due to language problems, psychological disorders, dementia, etc. of the participant
